required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Project PrEP-R: Network Support to Engage and Retain Younger Black MSM in PrEP Care
clinical_study.official_title: Project PrEP-R: Network Support to Engage and Retain Younger Black MSM in PrEP Care

collaborator.agency: Ann & Robert H Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago

brief_summary.textblock: The Project PrEP-R intervention is a brief, theory based and culturally sensitive intervention designed to capitalize on organic yet underutilized social support networks in the lives of young black men who have sex with men (YBMSM). The intervention has been developed with input from clients and their support network members, case managers, social workers, primary care providers. The goal of the intervention is to improve retention in PrEP care for young Black MSM.

detailed_description.textblock: Project PrEP-R will recruit, consent and randomize 160 men, with 80 men randomized to each arm of the study. Men randomized to the control condition will receive standard PrEP care at each clinical site. Men randomized to the experimental condition will receive standard PrEP care and also will be asked to recruit a supportive contact from their social network. The support contact will then be engaged in a brief intervention designed to support their friend/family member around PrEP Care. Men and support contacts in the PrEP-R intervention also will receive booster sessions via telephone and text. All participants will complete surveys at baseline and at three and twelve months post intervention.

primary_outcome.description: Completing scheduled PrEP visits as determined by EMR data

secondary_outcome.description: HIV serostatus and STI testing as determined by EMR data
Closeness and social support measures based on self-report

arm_group.description: Routine PrEP Care at each clinical site.
Support contact will provide emotional support and practical support in order to help their friend/family member to stay engaged in PrEP Care.

intervention.description: Provide emotional support and practical support. Support friend/family by helping him to stay engaged in PrEP Care.

clinical_study.keyword: Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP); Retention in PrEP Care
